entry.RedBlue: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
entry.Yellow: If you touch the feeler on top of its head, it will release a horrible stink to protect itself.
entry.Gold: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
entry.Silver: Its feet have suction cups designed to stick to any surface. It tenaciously climbs trees to forage.
entry.Crystal: It crawls into foliage where it camouflages itself among leaves that are the same color as its body.
entry.RubySapphire: CATERPIE has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger than its body right before your eyes. From its antenna, this POKéMON releases a terrifically strong odor.
entry.FireRed: It is covered with a green skin. When it grows, it sheds the skin, covers itself with silk, and becomes a cocoon.
entry.LeafGreen: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
entry.Emerald: Its voracious appetite compels it to devour leaves bigger than itself without hesitation. It releases a terribly strong odor from its antennae.
entry.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It releases a stench from its red antenna to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.
entry.HeartGold: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antennae on its head to drive away enemies.
entry.SoulSilver: Its feet have suction cups designed to stick to any surface. It tenaciously climbs trees to forage.
entry.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It releases a stench from its red antenna to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.
entry.X: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antennae on its head to drive away enemies.
entry.Y: Its feet have suction cups designed to stick to any surface. It tenaciously climbs trees to forage.
entry.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Caterpie has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger than its body right before your eyes. From its antenna, this Pokémon releases a terrifically strong odor.
entry.Sun: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.
entry.Moon: It’s easy to catch, and it grows quickly, making it one of the top recommendations for novice Pokémon Trainers.

Gold: Route 2, 26, 27, 30, 31, 34, 35, 36, 37, 38, 39, Azalea Town, Ilex Forest, Lake of Rage, National Park
HeartGold: Route 2, 30, 31, Ilex Forest, National Park, Viridian Forest
